title: Older Whitbread Brewery Logotype
content:
Would like some help with identifying this face – if custom drawn, any close digitised font suggestions will be welcome. Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829132305im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wb_4330.jpg)
author: OHP

comments.content:
A 19th century style with triangular [or wedge] serifs called Latin.  
I didn't spot an exact match, but consider: Zuzana Licko's Matrix II [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/matrix-ii-ot/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829132305/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/matrix-ii-ot/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/matrix-ii-ot/") PL Latin [http://www.linotype.com/157461/PLLatinBold-product.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829132305/http:/www.linotype.com/157461/PLLatinBold-product.html "http://www.linotype.com/157461/PLLatinBold-product.html") Latin CT Semi Condensed [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/latin-ct/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829132305/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/latin-ct/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/latin-ct/") Ennio FY [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontyou/ennio-fy/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829132305/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontyou/ennio-fy/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontyou/ennio-fy/")  
Don
Thanks Don, that's a good start.
